question:
Recently, the Chief Justice of India Dipak Misra recommended for the impeachment of Justice Shri Narayan Shukla, a senior judge of the Allahabad High Court. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. The procedure of impeachment is same for judges of Supreme Court and High Courts
  2. Not a single Judge has been impeached in India so far.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct.</u> The procedure of impeachment is same for the judges of Supreme Court and High Court Judges. A judge of Supreme Court can be removed only on grounds of proved misbehaviour or incapacity. The Judges Inquiry Act, 1968 provides for the inquiry of the conduct of a judge to prove the charges against him/her. The same procedure is followed for removal of judge of High Court. <u>Second statement is correct.</u> The procedure for impeachment of judges in India is highly complex due to which all impeachment proceedings so far have failed.
